snippet: The affiliation could pull the organization, Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, away from its focus on attacking Egyptian military and security forces and toward the Islamic State’s mass killings of civilians.
abstract: Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, Egypt's most dangerous militant group, pledges obedience to Islamic State organization; move is first significant international affiliate in bet that link will provide new money, weapons and recruits to battle Egyptian government; affiliation could pull group away from its current, almost exclusive focus on attacking Egyptian military and security forces.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt from Washington, and Kareem Fahim, Asmaa al-Zohairy and Mohamad Adam from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The affiliation could pull the organization, Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, away from its focus on attacking Egyptian military and security forces and toward the Islamic State’s mass killings of civilians.

headline.main: Militant Group in Egypt Vows Loyalty to ISIS
headline.print_headline: Militant Group in Egypt Vows Loyalty to ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
